# @jsondb-cloud/cli

> CLI for jsondb.cloud — manage a hosted JSON document database from the terminal.

## Overview

jsondb.cloud is a hosted JSON document database with a REST API. The `jsondb` CLI lets you authenticate, push/pull data, manage collections, schemas, versions, and webhooks directly from the terminal. It wraps the jsondb.cloud API into simple commands.

## Installation

- npm: `npm install -g @jsondb-cloud/cli`
- Homebrew: `brew install jsondbcloud/tap/jsondb`
- Standalone binaries: download from https://github.com/JsonDBCloud/cli/releases (macOS arm64/x64, Linux x64/arm64)

## Authentication

- `jsondb login` — prompts for API key (keys start with `jdb_sk_`)
- Credentials stored at `~/.config/jsondb/credentials.json`
- `jsondb logout` — removes stored credentials
- `jsondb whoami` — shows current authenticated user

## Configuration

Environment variables:
- `JSONDB_API_KEY` — API key (overrides stored credentials)
- `JSONDB_PROJECT` — default project namespace
- `JSONDB_BASE_URL` — API base URL (for self-hosted or staging)

Global flags (apply to any command):
- `--api-key <key>` — API key for this request
- `--project <ns>` — project namespace
- `--base-url <url>` — API base URL
- `--format <fmt>` — output format: json, raw, ndjson, table

## Commands

### Auth
- `jsondb login` — authenticate with API key
- `jsondb logout` — remove stored credentials
- `jsondb whoami` — show current user

### Documents
- `jsondb get <path>` — retrieve a document by path
- `jsondb create <collection>` — create a new document (reads JSON from stdin or flags)
- `jsondb update <path>` — replace a document at the given path
- `jsondb patch <path>` — partially update a document
- `jsondb delete <path>` — delete a document

### Collections
- `jsondb collections` — list all collections
- `jsondb documents <collection>` — list documents in a collection

### Import/Export
- `jsondb push <file> --to <collection>` — import a local JSON file into a collection
- `jsondb pull <collection>` — export a collection to a local file

### Schema
- `jsondb schema get <collection>` — retrieve the schema for a collection
- `jsondb schema set <collection>` — set or update a collection schema
- `jsondb schema remove <collection>` — remove the schema from a collection

### Versions
- `jsondb versions list <collection> <id>` — list version history for a document
- `jsondb versions get <collection> <id> <version>` — retrieve a specific version
- `jsondb versions diff <collection> <id>` — show diff between versions
- `jsondb versions restore <collection> <id> <version>` — restore to a previous version

### Webhooks
- `jsondb webhooks list <collection>` — list webhooks for a collection
- `jsondb webhooks create <collection>` — create a new webhook
- `jsondb webhooks get <collection> <id>` — get webhook details
- `jsondb webhooks update <collection> <id>` — update a webhook
- `jsondb webhooks delete <collection> <id>` — delete a webhook
- `jsondb webhooks test <collection> <id>` — send a test event to a webhook

### API Keys
- `jsondb keys list` — list API keys
- `jsondb keys create` — create a key (requires dashboard auth)
- `jsondb keys revoke <id>` — revoke a key (requires dashboard auth)

### Utilities
- `jsondb validate <collection>` — validate documents against the collection schema
- `jsondb count <collection>` — count documents in a collection
- `jsondb bulk <collection>` — perform bulk operations on a collection

## Quick Example

```bash
jsondb login
jsondb collections
jsondb push ./data/users.json --to users
jsondb get users/usr_abc123
jsondb pull users --out users.json
```

## More Information

For complete documentation with all parameters, examples, and response formats, see llms-full.txt.

- Docs: https://jsondb.cloud/docs
- Related packages:
  - `@jsondb-cloud/client` — JavaScript/TypeScript SDK
  - `@jsondb-cloud/mcp` — MCP server for AI agents
  - `jsondb-cloud` (PyPI) — Python SDK
